title: Hewlet
author: Hewlet
content: I came across an advert from the office of the minister of the Federal Ministry of Communication, innovation, and Digital Technology regarding the 3MTT. (3 million technical talent program ) a program that is designed to train 3 million Nigerians on key technological skills including1. Software development 2. UI/UX design 3. Data analysis and visualization 4. Quality assurance 5. Product Management 6. Data science 7. Animation 8. AI/ machine learning. 8. Cyber security. 9. Game development 10. Cloud Computing 11. Devs ops.I picked a lot of interest in it because I feel that if this is genuinely carried out, it would go a long way in increasing the employability of the average Nigerian youth that will benefit from the program and this led me to follow up on the ministry activity on YouTube and from the analysis on how the program is structured, it appears to me as one that will be very feasible. Here is the link to the YouTube briefing by the minister. https://www.youtube.com/live/yFmPeZKKj38?si=uyrhZHKUQb63NN5N  I had to go up to their site and was amazed at how innovative the plan of the minister had been coupled with the fact that in May of this year, the ministry brought out a policy that is aimed at getting blockchain technology accepted in the country and the document contains reasons why the blockchain technology should be accepted in Nigeria. Maybe you should check it out. https://www.commtech.gov.ng/Doc/National_Blockchain_Policy_Final.pdf. Here is my take on this, Dr Bosun Tojani is a youth that is into the technological sector and has a lot of passion for the blockchain technology and this is what led him to creating the 3MTT program and also came up with the national blockchain technology. No matter the success or failure rate of this projects, If we have like minded individuals like bosun tojani in key political position both at the state and federal level, it won't take time before the technically innovative part of our country will spring up tall to the peak and it will become easier for bitcoin and the blockchain technology to be adopted in Nigeria.

Software development 2. UI/UX design3. Data analysis and visualization4. Quality assurance5. Product Management6. Data science7. Animation8. AI/ machine learning.8. Cyber security.9. comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: Quote from: Justbillywitt on November 17, 2023, 06:26:03 PMYes the information is true I have come across it and I even applied.  sure, it is true. I also applied and they've already sent out messages to the first phase of 3000 applicant that have successfully finished up there application process and will run the program for them between next month to February. The next phase will commence by march and from the information I gathered from the minister during his briefing, this current set of applicant would be used as a model to check how the programme will look like so as to make necessary changed before the next set, this is the reason when they only sent out the message to 1% of the applicant after which they will accept the next 10% of the 3 million and follow up in that manner.
